Description: Glazed steatite scarab; glaze worn; pierced longitudinally; engraved elytra, head and legs and on the base a ram-headed sphinx wearing an atef crown with a maat feather to front and a sun disc at the rear.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Enkomi
Bibliographic references: Jacobsson 1994 / Aegyptiaca from Late Bronze Age Cyprus (No. 277)
Kenna 1971 / Catalogue of the Cypriote Seals of the Bronze Age in the British Museum (No. 76)
Murray, Smith and Walters 1900 / Excavations in Cyprus (P37, Pl IV)
Peltenburg 1986 / Ramesside Egypt and Cyprus (P. 161, No. 1)
